messages.message: Hi team, running into a UI/UX issue with folders that contain many files (enough to require the Load More button) being pressed, and folders within them (i.e. a folder contains folder `zzz`  and files `file0001`  through `file5000` ). When attempting to copy a file into the nested folder, the UI will not display that folder in the copy interface. When attempting to manually navigate to that folder, copying into that folder is not possible as the paste button is grayed out. (relevant ticket (https://instabase.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/8033))

Hey! This isn't a great solution, but it should work - that list of files/folders is an infinite loader, which means that if you scroll down to the bottom more will be loaded. Soooo you should try scrolling down to the bottom... and scrolling... and scrolling... until that folder loads. We also sort the nodes by type, which means that once that folder loads, it will be at the top of the list, so you'll have to scroll back up to check for it. Sorry, I know it's not ideal!!

Tested and confirmed that, thank you :slightly_smiling_face: . I think the customer folder could be upwards of 10-15k files, so for now the workaround I’ve suggested is to recreate the end file structure externally and copy in such a way as to merge folders, but if that does not work I will recommend this.

Long term, is it possible we could look to add the existing “Load All” button to this interface that is present in the File Explorer proper?
Could you make an EPD feature ticket for it? I could see it possibly being useful for AI Hub in the future, even though we're much less likely to deal with that kind of scale in the UI of AI Hub.
We have a EPD ticket to sort the files by node type here: https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-2023
Looks like in file picker v2 they are not sorted at all, but in file picker v1 (this use case), they are sorted by node type
I guess the issue we're seeing here would be solved if we could sort in the backend by node type though

In v2, nodes are sorted by node names, not node type. The reason is that the list dir response is paginated and the backend sorts the nodes by node names. In v1, you can see that when you scroll down multiple times, the folder appears on the top, so you have to scroll back up to the top to use the folder
